enb_long_title: Third Conference of the Parties to the Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: News that Al Gore is to fly into Kyoto Sunday was greeted with speculation about the significance of the Vice Presidents attendance for the US negotiating position.
Optimists were quick to suggest that Gore would be unlikely to attend the COP only to defend the current US target for stabilisation by 1990.
Instead, they argued, the visit suggested he might preside over an improved offer on GFG reduction targets.
Noting that Gore would spend only eight hours in Kyoto, an NGO observer said she did not believe the Vice President would negotiate.
